put.description:
Association is performed without validating if the site has a hostname covered by the certificate. This is useful for preparation work required for getting a site ready for traffic.

If a certificate is uploaded which contains hostnames for sites, it will automatically be connected to those sites. If a hostname is added to a site which is covered by an SSL certificate, it will automatically be connected to the certificate.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

get.description: A site's hostname should point to these CNAME targets in order for traffic to be sent through StackPath's edge nodes.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

get.description:
Event statistics collect the total number of and number of blocked events for a site over a given time frame. Statistics are collected per country of origin, the rules that triggered events, the requesting organization as determined by WHOIS lookup against the client IP address, and by actions taken by the WAF as a result of the event.

**Note:** This endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. WAF events will be replaced with requests, which provide more functionality. A replacement for this call is in development.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: A lower bound date to search events for.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: An upper bound date to search events for.

parameters.name: filter.client_ip
parameters.description: Filter events by client IP address.

parameters.name: filter.reference_id
parameters.description: Filter events by reference ID. Reference IDs are displayed to the end user when the WAF blocks a request to a site. Please note that an event's ID and reference ID are different.

delete.description: Restore the WAF feature's original enabled or disabled state.

post.description: Sites in monitoring mode accept incoming requests and log but take no action on policy and rule violations. A sitge's WAF feature must be enabled for monitoring mode to apply. Otherwise, monitoring mode will take effect the next time the WAF feature is enabled.

get.description:
Retrieve a report of a stack or site's WAF traffic.

**Note:** This endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Please use the [v2 get traffic call](ref:gettrafficv2) to retrieve WAF site traffic.
Get tags available for use in WAF rule conditons. Tags describe aspects of an incoming web request and acn be used to create complex application-level custom rules.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: page_request.after
parameters.description: The cursor value after which data will be returned.

parameters.name: page_request.sort_by

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: A lower bound date to search traffic for.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: An upper bound date to search traffic for.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description:
- DAILY: All data points represent one day of traffic
 - HOURLY: All data points represent one hour of traffic
 - MINUTELY: All data points represent one minute of traffic

get.description: Retreive a report of a stack or site's WAF traffic

ConditionCountryCondition.description: Match the country that the requested originated from

fileExtension.description: The file extension, with or without a period character, to match against

exactMatch.description: Whether or not to perform an exact match of the request header and value

ConditionHeaderExistsCondition.description: Match when an incoming request header is present

ConditionIpCondition.description: Match the incoming request against a single IP address

lowerBound.description: The lower bound IPv4 address to match against

upperBound.description: The upper bound IPv4 address to match against

ConditionIpRangeCondition.description: Match the incoming request against a range of IPv4 addresses

ConditionOrganizationCondition.description: Match the organization the request originated from, as determined by a WHOIS lookup of the requesting IP

ownerTypes.description: The owner value to match against

ConditionOwnerTypeCondition.description: Match the type of organization that owns the IP address making an incoming request

ips.description: A list of source IPs that can trigger a request rate condition

httpMethods.description: Possible HTTP request methods that can trigger a request rate condition

pathPattern.description: A regular expression matching the URL path of the incoming request

requests.description: The number of incoming requests over the given time that can trigger a request rate condition

time.description: The number of seconds that the WAF measures incoming requests over before triggering a request rate condition

ConditionRequestRateCondition.description: Match the rate at which requests come in that match certain conditions

exactMatch.description: Whether to perform an exact match of the response header and value

ConditionResponseHeaderExistsCondition.description: Match when a response header is present

requestCount.description: The number of dynamic requests in the session

ConditionSessionRequestCountCondition.description:
Match the number of dynamic page requests made in a WAF session

The WAF injects a session cookie into protected pages to track multi-request security issues. This condition matches against the number of dynamic page requests made during that session's lifetime.

tags.description: A facet of the incoming request to match against

ConditionTagCondition.description: Match aspects of an incoming request

exactMatch.description: Whether to perform an exact match or a string contains match of the URL

userAgent.description: The user agent value to match

exactMatch.description: Whether to perform an exact match or a string contains match of the user agent

ConditionUserAgentCondition.description: Match the user agent making the request

clientName.description: The name of the requesting client, typically the name of the requesting web browser

clientType.description: The requesting client's type, such as "major browser" or "mobile app"

device.description: The brand name of the device making the request, such as "iphone" or "playstation"

os.description: The operating system of the device making the request

EventRequestUserAgent.description:
Parsed user agent information

Incoming user agents are parsed by StackPath into categories to help describe the type of device and HTTP client or browser that made a request that triggered a WAF event. Parsed user agent properties have the value "NA" if StackPath is unable to parse the incoming user agent.

ruleName.description: The name of the rule that triggered the event action

ruleId.description: The unique ID of the rule that triggered the event action

blocked.description: Whether the requesting client was blocked or not

engine.description: The name of the internal WAF engine powering the rule

EventRuleAction.description: Aspects of the rule that triggered a WAF event

EventStatistics.description: A collection of common event metrics

count.description: The number of requests that resulted in that action

MetricsActions.description: The number of events per action taken by the WAF

count.description: The number of requests from the country

MetricsCountries.description: The number of events per country of origin

count.description: The number of requests from the organization

MetricsOrganizations.description: The number of events per requesting organization, as determined by WHOIS lookup on the requesting IP

count.description: The number of requests the rule analyzed

MetricsRules.description: The "top threats" metric, the number of events encountered per rule

subnet.description: The IP bock of the organization

NetworkOrganization.description: The organization that owns the WAF request's originating IP address according to a WHOIS lookup

OwnerTypeConditionOwnerType.description: Potential owner type values to match against

RequestDetailsRequestType.description:
The types of a WAF request

- API: A WAF request to a URL designated by WAF as an API URL
 - AJAX: An AJAX WAF request
 - STATIC: A WAF request to a static resource

tags.description: The tags associated with the request

cached.description: Whether or not the tag was cached

RequestDetailsTags.description:
Aspects of a WAF request

Tags describe aspects of an incoming web request and can be used to create complex application-level custom rules

RuleActionResultType.description:
Results from a WAF event

- RESULT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: The event resulted in an unknown action
 - BLOCKED: The event was blocked by the WAF
 - ALLOWED: The event was allowed by the WAF
 - MONITORED: The event was monitored by the WAF but no action was taken

negation.description: Whether or not to apply a boolean NOT operation to the rule's condition

RuleCondition.description: The criteria of an incoming web request and the models of the various values those criteria can take

RuleStatusCode.description: A custom HTTP status code that the WAF returns if a rule blocks a request

SearchFilterActionFilter.description: Potential actions the WAF took on an event

SearchFilterResultFilter.description:
Potential final results the WAF took on the event

A result reflects the end result of an event. For instance, if a user was first challenged with a captcha and then passed or failed the captcha.

SiteAttachMode.description:
How a WAF site relates to other StackPath site features

- STANDALONE: This WAF site does not have a corresponding caching CDN site
 - ATTACHED: This WAF site represents the protection capabilities of a CDN site

rules.description: The "top threats" metric, the number of events encountered per rule

countries.description: The number of events per country of origin

organizations.description: The number of events per requesting organization, as determined by WHOIS lookup on the requesting IP

actions.description: The number of events per action taken by the WAF

StatisticsMetrics.description: A collection of common event metrics for a single WAF action

legitimateRequest.description: The number of requests that passed all policies and rules and were sent to the origin

whitelisted.description: The number of requests allowed by whitelist

allowedSearchEngine.description: The number of requests allowed by allow search bot policies

staticContent.description: The number of requests for static content that was not analyzed by the WAF

uncategorized.description: All uncategorized requests that the WAF passed to the origin

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

port.description: The http port to connect to the origin

securePort.description: The https port to connect to the origin

enabled.description: Whether or not a WAF policy is enabled

schemawafPolicy.description:
An individually toggleable WAF policy

Policies are pre-defined WAF rules created by StackPath for common firewall functionality.

path.description: The path of the requested URL

ruleName.description: The name of the WAF rule triggered by the request

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country where the request originated from

ruleId.description: The unique ID of the WAF rule that triggered the action against the request

userAgent.description: The full user agent string for the request

userAgentClient.description: The name of the requesting client, typically the name of the requesting web browser

organization.description: The organization that owns the request's originating IP address according to a WHOIS lookup

referenceId.description:
The request's user-facing identifier

Reference IDs are displayed to the end user when the WAF blocks a request to a site. Please note that a request's ID and reference ID are different.

ruleIds.description: The IDs of the rules to delete

fingerprint.description: A unique hash of a certificate's contents

commonName.description: A certificate's common name, or the primary domain name the certificate is used for

issuer.description: The name of the certificate's issuing certificate authority

caBundle.description: A PEM PKCS #7 formatted certificate authority bundle

trusted.description: Whether or not the certificate's authority is trusted by a web browser

expirationDate.description: The date an SSL certificate will expire

createDate.description: The date an SSL certificate was created

updateDate.description: The date an SSL certificate was last updated

subjectAlternativeNames.description:
A list of Subject Alternative Names in the certificate

Certificates for multiple domains define their domains in certificate's SAN list.

providerManaged.description: Whether a certificate is managed by StackPath or the end user

wafCertificateStatus.description:
A StackPath-provided certificate's status

- UNKNOWN: StackPath is unable to determine the certificate's status. This is the default status for end-user provided certificates.
 - PENDING: The certificate is provisioning
 - EXPIRED: The certificate has expired
 - FAILED: The certificate failed to provision
 - PENDING_VERIFICATION: The certificate is pending domain verification by the end user
 - ACTIVE: The certificate is valid and is in use by one or more hosts
 - INACTIVE: The certificate is valid but is not in use by any hosts

wafCertificateVerificationMethod.description:
The Certificate Verification Method

Verification method used to validate a requested certificate on a site

 - DNS: Verify a certificate using DNS records
 - HTTP: Verify a certificate by using HTTP validation. This will require that all hosts on the certificate point to the site hash or IP

wafConnectSiteToCertificateResponse.description: A response to a request to associate an SSL certificate with a WAF site

certificate.description: A PEM PKCS #7 formatted SSL certificate

key.description:
A PEM PKCS #7 formatted private key

Private keys are sent directly to the edge nodes and are not stored elsewhere on StackPath's systems.

caBundle.description: A PEM PKCS #7 formatted certificate authority bundle

wafCreateCertificateResponse.description: A response from a request to add an SSL certificate to a stack

conditions.description: The conditions required for a WAF rule to trigger

enabled.description: Whether or not the rule should be enabled on creation

actionDuration.description:
How long a rule's block action will apply to subsequent requests

Durations only apply to rules with block actions.

wafCreateRuleResponse.description: The results from a request to create a WAF rule

path.description: The path the WAF should request from the origin

port.description: The TCP port the WAF should connect to for http requests

securePort.description: The TCP port the WAF should connect to for https requests

hostHeader.description: The value of the Host header that the WAF should set when requesting from the origin. This field is deprecated and should not be used.

wafCreateSiteRequestType.description:
A WAF site's type

A site's type determines how StackPath delivers content to incoming HTTP requests.

 - WAF: The site is either a standalone WAF site or a WAF site with attached CDN service
 - API: The site is an API delivery site. API delivery sites are powered by both the WAF and CDN and have custom rulesets for each.

globalThreshold.description: The number of overall requests per ten seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

burstThreshold.description: The number of requests per two seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

subSecondBurstThreshold.description: The number of requests per 0.1 seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

wafDdosSettings.description:
A WAF site's DDOS protection settings

DDOS protection is activated if at least one of these conditions is met.

name.description:
The name of the network node to which a zone resource record pertains

Use the value "@" to denote current root domain name.

type.description:
A zone record's type

Zone record types describe the zone record's behavior. For instance, a zone record's type can say that the record is a name to IP address value, a name alias, or which mail exchanger is responsible for the domain. See https://support.stackpath.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001085563-What-DNS-record-types-does-StackPath-support for more information.

class.description:
A zone record's class code

This is typically "IN" for Internet related resource records.

ttl.description:
A zone record's time to live

A record's TTL is the number of seconds that the record should be cached by DNS resolvers. Use lower TTL values if you expect zone records to change often. Use higher TTL values for records that won't change to prevent extra DNS lookups by clients.

data.description:
A zone record's value

Expected data formats can vary depending on the zone record's type.

wafDnsRecord.description:
A DNS record

A dns record describes an individual piece of DNS functionality in a DNS zone.

dnsRecords.description: A list of DNS records that will validate domain ownership

records.description: A list of parsed dns records required for SSL verification

referenceId.description:
An event's user-facing identifier

Reference IDs are displayed to the end user when the WAF blocks a request to a site. Please note that an event's ID and reference ID are different.

count.description: Number of events which matched this

wafEvent.description:
A record of an action taken by the WAF

Events are generated by the WAF when an incoming request to a WAF-enabled site triggers a policy or custom rule. Events contain information about the request, the rule that was triggered, and the action taken by the WAF as a result (block the request, allow the request, present the user a captcha, etc).

country.description: The long name of the country where the request originated from

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country where the request originated from

organization.description: The organization that owns the originating IP address according to a WHOIS lookup

wafEventNetwork.description: A WAF event's network related aspects

method.description: The HTTP method that triggered a WAF event

scheme.description: The URL scheme that triggered a WAF event

uri.description: The full URL that triggered a WAF event

queryString.description: The query string portion of a URL that triggered a WAF event

headers.description: A key/value pair of the event's request headers

wafGetCertificateResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve an individual SSL certificate on a stack

manualVerificationRequired.description: Whether or not the end user must provide their own certificate verification

wafGetCertificateVerificationDetailsResp.description: A response from a request to retrieve an SSL certificate's manual verification details

wafGetCertificatesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's SSL certificates

wafGetDdosSettingsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's DDOS protection settings

wafGetEventResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a single WAF event

wafGetEventStatisticsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's event statistics

wafGetPoliciesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF policy group

wafGetPolicyGroupResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF policy group

wafGetPolicyGroupsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's policy groups

wafGetPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve an individual WAF policy

wafGetRequestDetailsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve all available information about a request to a WAF site

wafGetRequestResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve information about a request to a WAF site

results.description: The requested information about a WAF site's requests

wafGetRuleResponse.description: The results from a request to retrieve a WAF rule

wafGetRulesResponse.description: The results from a request to retrieve a site's WAF rules

wafGetSiteCertificatesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's SSL certificates

addresses.description: A list of DNS CNAME targets

wafGetSiteDnsTargetsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's DNS CNAME targets

wafGetTagsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve WAF tags

wafGetTrafficResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's WAF traffic

wafGetTrafficV2Response.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's WAF traffic

wafGetWAFOrganizationsResponse.description: A response for a request to get a WHOIS organization

wafHttpMethod.description:
HTTP methods of a request

- METHOD_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified HTTP method
 - GET: HTTP GET method
 - POST: HTTP POST method
 - PUT: HTTP PUT method
 - DELETE: HTTP DELETE method
 - HEAD: HTTP HEAD method
 - PATCH: HTTP PATCH method
 - OPTIONS: HTTP OPTIONS method
 - CONNECT: HTTP CONNECT method
 - TRACE: HTTP TRACE method

wafPolicyAction.description: The potential actions that the WAF will take when a policy is triggered

policies.description: A list of the policies in a policy group

wafPolicyGroup.description: A group of WAF policies with similar effect

wafRequestAction.description:
The actions that the WAF takes when a request triggers a WAF rule

- ACTION_UNSPECIFIED: The WAF performed an unspecified action with the request
 - BLOCK: The WAF blocked the request
 - ALLOW: The WAF allowed the request
 - CAPTCHA: The WAF presented the user with a captcha
 - HANDSHAKE: The WAF performed automatic browser validation
 - MONITOR: The WAF monitored the request but took no action

hosts.description:
An optional list of delivery domains that will be included as subject alternative names on the certificate

If no hosts are provided, all delivery domains on the site will be included with the first one in the list being used as the common name.  If hosts are provided the first entry will be used as the common name.

All entries in the list are validated against the existing delivery domains for the provided site.

wafRequestCertificateResponse.description: A response from a request to provision an SSL certificate for a WAF site

path.description: The path of the requested URL

ruleId.description: The unique ID of the WAF rule that triggered the action against the WAF request

ruleName.description: The name of the WAF rule triggered by the request

referenceId.description:
The WAF request's user-facing identifier

Reference IDs are displayed to the end user when the WAF blocks a request to a site. Please note that a request's ID and reference ID are different.

contentType.description: The content type of the WAF request

scheme.description: The HTTP scheme of the WAF request

httpStatusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the WAF request

httpVersion.description: The HTTP version of the WAF request

responseTime.description: The time it took the WAF to process the WAF request

requestHeaders.description: The HTTP request headers of the WAF request

incidentId.description: The ID of the of challenge that was generated for the WAF request

sessionRequestCount.description: The number of WAF requests in the session

wafRequestDetails.description: A request that was inspected by the WAF

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country where the request originated from

wafRequestDetailsNetwork.description: A WAF request's network related aspects

fullString.description: The full user agent string for the WAF request

client.description: The name of the requesting client, typically the name of the requesting web browser

clientVersion.description: The version of the requesting user agent's client, typically also the version of the requesting web browser

baseBrowser.description: The name of the requesting user agent's browser

baseBrowserVersion.description: The version of the requesting user agent's browser

os.description: The name of the requesting user agent's operating system

device.description: The name of the requesting user agent's device

deviceType.description: The type of the requesting user agent's device

cpu.description: The name of the requesting user agent's CPU

renderingEngine.description: The name of the requesting user agent's engine

wafRequestDetailsUserAgent.description: A WAF event's network related aspects

conditions.description:
The conditions required for the WAF engine to trigger the rule

Rules may have between 1 and 5 conditions. All conditions must pass for the rule to trigger.

enabled.description: Whether or not a WAF rule is enabled

actionDuration.description:
How long a rule's block action will apply to subsequent requests

Durations only apply to rules with block actions.

wafRule.description:
A custom WAF rule applied to a site

Unlike pre-defined policies, rules are provided by the user for custom WAF functionality.

wafRuleAction.description:
The actions that the WAF takes when a rule is triggered

- BLOCK: The WAF blocked the request
 - ALLOW: The WAF allowed the request
 - CAPTCHA: The WAF presented the user with a captcha
 - HANDSHAKE: The WAF performed automatic browser validation
 - MONITOR: The WAF monitored the request but took no action
 - GATEWAY: The WAF performed extended automatic browser validation

wafSearchEventsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a WAF site's events

name.description: The WAF site's name, used on stand-alone WAF sites

enabled.description: Whether or not a site's WAF service is enabled

apiUrls.description: A list of API URLs which receive different processing through the WAF than website requests

createdAt.description: The date a WAF site was created

updatedAt.description: The date a WAF site was last updated

deliveryId.description: For an ATTACHED site, the CDN site ID where caching can be enabled

monitoring.description:
Whether or not a site's WAF service is in a monitor state

WAF sites in monitoring mode accept incoming requests and log but take no action on policy and rule violations.

wafSite.description: A site's WAF service's general settings

valid.description:
Whether or not a site's SSL certificate is valid

An SSL certificate is valid when a hostname associated with the site is covered by the certificate.

wafSiteCertificate.description: An SSL certificate and its relationship with its associated site

wafSiteStatus.description:
A WAF site's available statuses

- ACTIVE: A WAF site is in active service
 - INACTIVE: A WAF site has been disabled by the user
 - SUSPENDED:  A WAF site has been disabled by StackPath for non-billing reasons (DMCA, abuse, etc)
 - BILLING_SUSPENDED: A WAF site has been disabled by StackPath for billing reasons
 - PROVISIONING: A WAF site is provisioning

wafSiteType.description:
A WAF site's type

A site's type determines how StackPath delivers content to incoming HTTP(S) requests.

 - UNKNOWN_TYPE: StackPath is unable to determine a site's type
 - WAF: A site is either a standalone WAF site or a WAF site with attached CDN service
 - API: A site is an API delivery site. API delivery sites are powered by both the WAF and CDN and have custom rulesets for each.

wafTag.description:
Aspects of an incoming HTTP request

StackPath provides shortcuts for the rules used in WAF policies for the creation of more complex WAF rules.

timestamp.description: The date and time traffic metrics were recorded for

ruleCount.description: The number of requests analyzed by rules

ruleBlocked.description: The number of requests blocked by rules

ddos.description: The number of requests handled by the layer 7 DDOS engine

originError4xx.description: The number of HTTP 4xx errors received from the origin

originError5xx.description: The number of HTTP 5xx errors received from the origin

originTimeout.description: The number of request timeouts from the WAF to the origin

responseTime.description: Average response time to the origin in milliseconds

wafTraffic.description: A set of individual time-series WAF traffic metrics

antiautomationAndBehavioral.description: The number of requests either handled or blocked by anti_automation and behavioral templates

csrf.description: The number of requests either handled or blocked by the CSRF template

ipReputation.description: The number of requests either handled or blocked by the IP reputation template

spamAndAbuse.description: The number of requests either handled or blocked by the spam and abuse template

waf.description: The number of requests either handled or blocked by REM templates

wafTrafficPolicy.description: Aspects of WAF traffic related to policies

timestamp.description: The date and time traffic metrics were recorded for

api.description: The number of requests to URLs designated as API URLs

static.description: The number of requests to static assets

customBlocked.description: The number of requests blocked by custom rules

policyBlocked.description: The number of requests blocked by policies

ddosBlocked.description: The number of requests blocked by layer 7 DDOS protection

customWhitelisted.description: The number of requests allowed by custom rules

policyWhitelisted.description: The number of requests from allowed search engines and other allowed bots

originError4xx.description: The number of HTTP 4xx errors received from the origin

originError5xx.description: The number of HTTP 5xx errors received from the origin

originTimeout.description: The number of request timeouts from the WAF to the origin

passedToOrigin.description: The number of requests that were passed to the origin

responseTime.description: The average response time to the origin in milliseconds

total.description: The total number of requests for the given time period

wafTrafficV2.description: A set of individual time-series WAF traffic metrics

certificate.description: A PEM PKCS #7 formatted SSL certificate

key.description:
A PEM PKCS #7 formatted private key

Private keys are sent directly to the edge nodes and are not stored elsewhere on StackPath's systems.

caBundle.description: A PEM PKCS #7 formatted certificate authority bundle

wafUpdateCertificateResponse.description: A response from a request to update an SSL certificate

globalThreshold.description: The number of requests per ten seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

burstThreshold.description: The number of requests per two seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

subSecondBurstThreshold.description: The number of requests per 0.1 seconds that can trigger DDOS protection

wafUpdateDdosSettingsResponse.description: A response from a request to update a WAF site's DDOS protection settings

conditions.description: The conditions required for a WAF rule to trigger

enabled.description: Whether or not the rule should be enabled

actionDuration.description:
How long a rule's block action will apply to subsequent requests

Durations only apply to rules with block actions.

wafUpdateRuleResponse.description: The results from a request to update a WAF rule

apiUrls.description: A list of API URLs that will be processed differently by the WAF
A list of API URLs that will be processed differently by the WAF

wafUpdateSiteApiUrlsResponse.description: A response from a request to update an WAF site's API URLs

wafVerificationRequirements.description: Conditions that must be met to verify ownership of a domain for SSL certificate provisioning
